subject: Cybersecurity
title: Dark Web Forums: Where Hackers Share Knowledge
description: A micro-lesson that makes Dark Web Forums: Where Hackers Share Knowledge usable.

hook.text: Underground forums are where hackers trade exploits, sell stolen data, and recruit for criminal operations.

buildup.text: Forums like RaidForums, BreachForums, and XSS serve as hubs where cybercriminals network and transact.

discovery.text: Reputation systems, escrow services, and moderators create trust among criminals who can't go to court if cheated.

twist.text: Law enforcement infiltrates these forums. The admin of RaidForums was a 21-year-old Portuguese man arrested in the UK.

climax.text: Dark web forums mirror legitimate marketplaces: reviews, warranties, and customer support â€” for illegal products.

punchline.text: Criminal marketplaces have customer reviews and refund policies.

quiz.question: How do dark web forums establish trust between criminals?
options: Through reputation systems, escrow services, and moderation
